(with or without ἐν), come to, ἔν τʼ Ὠκεανοῦ πελάγεσσι μίγεν P. 4.251; Λακεδαιμονίων μιχθέντες ἀνδρῶν ἤθεσιν ib. 257; ἐν αἱμακουρίαις μέμικται is present at that feast, O. 1.91; φύλλοις ἐλαιᾶν μιχθέντα, στεφάνοις ἔμιχθεν ( 3 pl.), come to, i.e. win, the crown of victory, N. 1.18, 2.22; μ. εὐλογίαις I. 3.3; μ. ἐν τιμαῖς ib. 2.29; μ. θάμβει to be affected by amazement, N. 1.56; also βροτοὶ ξὺν κακοῖς μεμ<ε>ιγμένοι S. El. 1485.
mix in fight, Il. 4.456, cf. Od. 5.317; ἐν δαΐ, ἐν παλάμῃσι μ., Il. 13.286, 21.469.

Hom. and Hes. most freq. of the sexes, have intercourse with, both of the man and the woman, sts. abs., Il. 9.275, etc.: more freq. μιγῆναί τινι, of the man, 21.143, etc.; of the woman, Od. 1.73; ἄρσενι θῆλυ μιγῆν Parm. 12.5, cf. Pi. P. 3.14, al.; but in Trag. only of the man, as μητρὶ μ<ε>ιχθῆναι, μιγῆναι, S. OT 791, 995; but in Com. μ<ε>ιγνυμένας τοῖσιν ἀδελφοῖς Ar. Ra. 1081 (anap.): in Prose pres. μίσγεσθαι in this sense, of the man, Hdt. 2.64, etc.; of the woman, Id. 1.5, 199, Od. 22.445; in full, φιλότητί τινι μιγῆναι, of the man, Il. 6.165; of the woman, ib. 161, Hes. Th. 927, 970, etc.; ἐμισγέσθην φ., of the two, Il. 14.295; ἐν φιλότητι μίσγεσθαι (with or without τινι), of the man, 2.232, 24.131; of the woman, h.Hom. 33.5; Διὸς φιλότητι μιγῆναι, Διὸς ἐν φ. μ., of the woman, Hes. Th. 920, h.Merc. 4; σῇ φ. μ., of the man, h.Ven. 150; εὐνῇ μ., of the man, Od. 1.433; φιλότητι καὶ εὐνῇ, of the man, Il. 3.445, cf. Od. 15.420; of the woman, 5.126; but ἐν ἀγκοίνῃσι Διός 11.268: c. acc. cogn., φιλότης . . , ἣν ἐμίγης Il. 15.33.—The aor. 1 is not used in this sense by Hom., but occurs in the Hymns, h.Ven. 46, al.; the aor. 1 is more freq. in Hes. and Pi. (Cf. Lat. misceo, Skt. meksáyati ‘stir’, miśrás ‘mixed’.)
smiling, Hymn.Is. 147.

smile, Ep. Verb, only 3 sg. aor. μείδησε Il. 1.595, 5.426, Od. 4.609, Hes. Sc. 115, etc.; part. μειδήσας, -σασα Il. 1.596, etc.; inf. μειδῆσαι h.Cer. 204; μείδησε σαρδάνιον (v. Σαρδάνιος) Od. 20.301; opp. γελᾶν, laugh aloud, μειδῆσαι γελάσαι τε h.Cer. l.c.; κάρχαρόν τι μειδήσας grinning so as to show his teeth, Babr. 94.6:— pres. is supplied by μειδιάω, used by Hom. only in Ep. part. μειδιόων Il. 7.212, 23.786; - ιόωσα 21.491: later 3 sg. μειδιάει h.Hom. 10.3, μειδιᾷ Theoc. 30.5; part. μειδιάων h.Hom. 7.14, μειδιῶσα Ar. Th. 513; inf. μειδιᾶν Pl. Prm. 130a: impf. ἐμειδία Luc. DMeretr. 3.2; Ep. μειδιάασκε PLit.Lond. 41, Q.S. 9.117: aor. 1 ἐμειδίᾱσα Plu. Apophth.reg. 2.172b, Luc. Dear.Iud. [DDeor. 20.]11; inf. μειδιᾶσαι Apollod. 1.5.3; part. μειδιάσας Pl. Phd. 86d; Aeol. fem. - ιάσαισα Sapph. 1.14. (Cf. Skt. smáyati, Lett. smaidīt ‘smile’, etc.)
smile, Hes. Th. 205 (pl.).
smile, smiling, Luc. Bis Acc. 28: pl., Plu. Sull. 35, Corn. ND 24:—also μειδί-ᾱσις, εως, ἡ, Poll. 6.199, Porph. Abst. 4.6:

definition: μειδιασμός, ὁ, Poll. l.c., Sch. Ar. Pl. 165.

children.definition: conducive to smiling: μ., τό, hilarity, Ar. Pl. 27.
multiplied by a larger number, opp. ἐλαττονάκις, Nicom. Ar. 2.17, cf. Iamb. in Nic. p.95 P.
office of a μείζων (cf. μέγας C.1, POxy. 1147.9 (vi A. D.).
greater magnitude, Iamb. VP 26.115, in Nic. p.33 P.

definition: μείης, ὁ, coined as etym. of μείς (

children.definition: Pl. Cra. 409c.
Suid.
soothing things, esp. of gifts, ἐγὼ δʼ ἐπὶ μ. δώσω, of a bridal dowry, Il. 9.147, cf. 289, Luc. Epigr. 2; so of playthings, etc., A.R. 3.146: sg., ib. 135.

children.label: II
children.definition: propitiations, δαίμοσιν . . νόστῳ ἔπι μ. θέσθαι Id. 4.1549; of offerings to the dead, BCH 36.230 ( Rhodes, iii B. C.): rarely in sg., μείλιον ἀπλοΐης charm against storms, Call. Dian. 230; offering to a god, AP 6.75 ( Paul.Sil.).
satisfaction, penalty, μ. τείσειν A.R. 3.594.

that which soothes, μειλίγματα θυμοῦ scraps with which the master appeases the hunger of his dogs, Od. 10.217; μειλίγματα προσφέρειν E. Fr. 1053: sg., Nic. Fr. 75: metaph., γλώσσης ἐμῆς μ. καὶ θελκτήριον A. Eu. 886; μ. νούσου Nic. Th. 896; λύπης Ph. 2.28 (pl.); τῆς ὀργῆς Plu. Pomp. 47; πλούτου μειλίγματα Epic. Oxy. 1015.19.
propitiatory offerings to the dead, A. Ch. 15, Eu. 107, Parth. 12.1, Ant.Lib. 25.5.
darling, fondling, Χρυσηΐδων μ., of Agamemnon, A. Ag. 1439.

children.label: II
children.definition: soothing song, λιγεῶν μειλίγματα Μουσέων Theoc. 22.221.
μ. θρασειῶν μεταφορῶν phrases which soften bold metaphors, Longin. 32.3.
able to soothe, εὐχαί Suid. s.v. Ποντίφιξ: Subst. μειλικτήρια (sc. ἱερά), τά, propitiations, νεκροῖσι A. Pers. 610; cf. μείλιγμα I.2.

definition: μειλικτικός, ή, όν, = foreg. Adv. - κῶς Sch. Ar. Pl. 233.
μειλικτός, ή, όν, only in Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 35.8 ( Mesom. (?)) μύθους μειλικτοὺς ἀνδρῶν ἔργοις,

children.definition: mingled (cf. ἀμείλικτον· ἄμικτον, Hsch.).

definition: Μειλινόη, ἡ, euphem. name of Hecate, Orph. H. 71 ( Μηλ- codd.).
μείλινος, η, ον, Ep. for μέλινος (q.v.).

children.definition: propitiation, Anon. ap. Suid. s.v. μειλίγμασιν.

children.label: II
children.definition: BCH 37.149 ( Thrace), SIG 888.26 (ibid., iii A. D.).

definition: μειλίσσω, fut. - ξω A.R. 4.416: Ep. aor. Med. μειλίξατο Id. 1.650: —

children.definition: make mild, soothe, treat kindly, τινα Theoc. 16.28; esp. appease, propitiate: rarely c. gen., πυρὸς μειλισσέμεν (like πυρὸς χαρίζεσθαι) to appease [the dead] by fire, i.e. funeral rites, Il. 7.410; of rivers, λιπαροῖς χεύμασι γαίας . . μειλίσσοντες οὖδας gladdening the soil with rich streams, A. Supp. 1029 (lyr.); ὀργὰς μ. E. Hel. 1339 (lyr.); μ. τινὰ λοιβαῖς, χύτλοις, Lyc. 542, A.R. 4.708.
implore, ἐγὼ κεῖνόν γε τεὰς ἐς χεῖρας ἱκέσθαι μειλίξω ib. 416.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., μειλίσσομαι to be soothed, grow calm, h.Cer. 290; to be subdued, πυρὸς μειλίσσετʼ ἀϋτμή A.R. 3.531.

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., use soothing words, μηδέ τί μʼ αἰδόμενος μειλίσσεο μηδʼ ἐλεαίρων extenuate not aught from respect or pity, Od. 3.96.
propitiate, Κύπριν ἀοιδῇσιν θυέεσσί τε A.R. 1.860; συκοφάντας ἀπομαγδαλιᾷ Philostr. VA 7.23; soften, subdue, ἔθνη . . καθάπερ ζῷα τιθασεύων καὶ μ. Plu. Alex. fort. 2.330b.

data.quote: ἔθνη . . καθάπερ ζῷα τιθασεύων καὶ μ.

children.definition: boxing-glove which left the fingers bare, Paus. 8.40.3.
gentleness, softness, μειλιχίη πολέμοιο lukewarmness in battle, Il. 15.741; kindness, Hes. Th. 206, A.R. 2.1279, etc.
Hsch.
temple of Ζεὺς Μειλίχιος, IG 14.352i16 ( Halaesa).

definition: μειλίχιος, α, ον, also ος, ον Plu. Isid. 2.370d, cf. Hsch.:—

children.definition: gentle, soothing, Hom. mostly of speech, μειλιχίοις ἐπέεσσι Il. 12.267, al.; μ. μῦθος Od. 6.148, cf. B. 10.90: without Subst., προσαυδᾶν μειλιχίοισι with gentle words, Il. 4.256, 6.214; οἱ δέ τʼ ἐς αὐτὸν τερπόμενοι λεύσσουσιν—ὁ δʼ ἀσφαλέως ἀγορεύει—αἰδοῖ μειλιχίῃ Od. 8.172; θεὸν ὣς ἱλάσκονται αἰδοῖ μειλιχίῃ Hes. Th. 92. Adv. - ίως A.R. 2.467, etc.: neut. as Adv., μειλίχιον μυκήσατο Mosch. 2.97.

data.quote: οἱ δέ τʼ ἐς αὐτὸν τερπόμενοι λεύσσουσιν—ὁ δʼ ἀσφαλέως ἀγορεύει—αἰδοῖ μειλιχίῃ

children.label: II
children.definition: mild, gracious, Ζεὺς M. the protector of those who invoked him with propitiatory offerings, at Athens, IG 1(2).866 (written Μιλίχιος), Th. 1.126, X. An. 7.8.4; at Orchomenus in Boeotia, IG 7.3169 (written Μιλίχιος BCH 50.422 ( Thespiae)); in Argolis, Paus. 2.20.1, etc.; of other divinities, as Dionysus, Plu. Es. carn. 1 2.994a, etc.; Κύπρις AP 5.225 ( Paul.Sil.): Cret., Theraean Μηλίχιος GDI 5046 ( Hierapytna), al., IG 12(3).406, 1316; early Ion. Μειλίχιος written Μελ- ib. 12(5).727 ( Andros); Arc. written Μελίχιος ib. 5(2).90 ( Tegea, perh. iv B. C.).

children.label: III
children.definition: μειλίχια (sc. ἱερά) propitiatory offerings, Plu. Def.orac. 2.417c; so perh. μ. ποτά S. OC 159 (lyr., but expld. by Sch. as referring to honey mixed in the drink-offerings).
Schwyzer 725.2 ( Milet., vi B. C., written μελ-).
mild-counselling, Procl. H. 7.40.
soft-voiced, γλῶσσα Tyrt. 12.8.
giving pleasing gifts, [ οἶνος] Hermipp. 82.2; Ὑγίεια Hymn. ap. Stob. 1.1.31a.
gentle-hearted, BCH 23.302 ( Termessus).
soft-smiling, Alc. 55:—also μειλῐχο-μειδής (- μετίδης cod.), Hsch.

definition: μείλιχος, ον, Aeol. μέλλιχος Hdn.Gr. 2.302, cj. in Sapph. 100:—

children.definition: gentle, kind:

children.label: I
children.definition: Il. always of persons, πᾶσιν γὰρ ἐπίστατο μ. εἶναι 17.671; μ. αἰεί 19.300, al.; epith. of Λητώ, Ὕπνος, Hes. Th. 406, 763: c. gen., Ἄρτεμις μ. ὠδίνων soother of . . , AP 6.242 ( Crin.): Sup. μειλιχώτατος IG 7.115.1 ( Megara): in late Prose, Jul. Or. 2.86a, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: Od., οὐ μ. ἔστιν ἀκοῦσαι οὔτʼ ἔπος οὔτε τι ἔργον 15.374; μ. δῶρα h.Hom. 10.2; ἔπεα Hes. Th. 84; οἶνος Xenoph. 1.6; αἰών, ὀργά, Pi. P. 8.97, 9.43; τὸ μ. gentleness, Thgn. 365; τὰ μείλιχα joys, Pi. O. 1.30; μείλιχα μυθεῖσθαι Opp. C. 3.219. Adv. - χως, μυθεύμενος Semon. 7.18: neut. as Adv., μείλιχον ἀντιάαν A.R. 1.971.

data.quote: οὐ μ. ἔστιν ἀκοῦσαι οὔτʼ ἔπος οὔτε τι ἔργον

children.definition: gentle, τὸ μ. Cerc. 18.10.

definition: μεῖξις, μειξοβάρβαρος, μείξοφρυς, v. μίξις, μιξοβάρβαρος, μίξοφρυς.

children.definition: lamb or sheep offered at the Athenian Apaturia by a father who was enrolling his son among his φράτερες, τοῦ μείου IG 2(2).1237.5; τὰ μεῖα ib. 60; παρέστησε μεῖον Is. Fr. 124: expld. by Sch. Ar. Ra. 810 (cf. Eratosth. and Apollod. ap. Harp.) as neut. of μείων, too light! from the cry of the φράτερες when the lamb was weighed; cf. μειαγωγέω.
v.l. in Dsc. 1.3, Androm. ap. Gal. 14.43.

have too little, to be poor, σὺν τῷ γενναίῳ μ., opp. σὺν τῷ ἀδίκῳ πλέον ἔχειν, X. Ages. 4.5; come short, μ. εἰ μή . . Id. Cyr. 8.6.23, cf. Mem. 3.14.6; μ. ἔν τινι fall short in a thing, Id. Hier. 1.11, 27: c. gen. rei, to be short of a thing, σίτων καὶ ποτῶν ib. 2.1; μ. τῶν εὐφροσυνῶν ἔν τινι ib. 1.29; τῶν δικαίων D.H. 6.71: c. gen. pers. et dat. rei, τῇ εὐφροσύνῃ μ. τῶν ἰδιωτῶν X. Hier. 1.18; opp. πλεονεκτέω, Hierax ap. Stob. 3.9.54.
disposed to take too little, opp. πλεονεκτικός, Hierax ap. Stob. 3.9.54.
taking less than oneʼs due, opp. πλεονεξία, X. Cyr. 2.1.25, Hierax ap. Stob. 3.9.54, Simp. in Cael. 171.20.
remission of fever, Aët. 5.77, Steph. in Gal. 1.268 D.
minimizing, A.D. Conj. 250.9, 253.16.

children.label: II
children.definition: minority, Vett.Val. 337.25.
thoughtless, Hsch.

lessen, diminish, opp. αὔξω, Phld. Oec. p.21 J. ( Pass.); μ. τὸ χωρίον Plb. 9.20.3; μ. τὸν ὁπλισμὸν τοῖς θώραξιν diminish the armour by the breast-pieces, D.H. 4.16; μειούμενον φόρον PFay. 26.15 (ii A. D.); moderate, τὴν ἄγαν κάθαρσιν X. Eq. 5.9.
lessen in honour, degrade, τοὺς φίλους Id. HG 3.4.9; τὴν ἐξ Ἀρείου πάγου βουλήν D.S. 11.77.
lessen by word, disparage, τὰ τῶν πολεμίων X. Cyr. 6.3.17, cf. Hier. 2.17; αὔξειν καὶ μειοῦν Arist. Rh. 1403a17.
shorten a syllable, D.H. Comp. 11: generally, λέξεων κατὰ ποσότητα μεμειωμένων Hdn.Gr. 2.909.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., become smaller, decrease, in size, etc., σπλὴν ἐμειοῦτο Hp. Epid. 1.4.3 [1.26.γʹ], cf. Pl. Cra. 409c; δελήνη μειουμένη Arist. Mu. 399a7, cf. Ph. 2.153, al.
become worse or weaker, μ. τὴν διάνοιαν X. Mem. 4.8.1: c. gen., fall short of, τῶν . . μεγάλα θυόντων ib. 1.3.3; τῆς τοῦ σώματος ἰσχύος Id. Cyr. 7.5.65.
boyish mischief, prob. in Epicur. Sent.Palat. 5p.69 v.d.M.
boy-cheater, Epigr. ap. Hegesand. I.
play the boy: hence, to be bashful, coquettish, Plu. Ant. 10, Luc. DMort. 22[27].9, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: attain puberty, ἐς ἡλικίαν μ. Arr. An. 4.13.1.

Dim. of μεῖραξ, lad, stripling, Antipho 3.3.11, Ar. Nu. 917 (anap.), Pl. R. 497e, Prt. 315d, Men. Georg. 46; ἔφηβος, μ., ἀνήρ, γέρων Id. 18 D.; ἄχρι γενείου λαχνώσιος, ἐς τὰ τρὶς ἑπτά Hp. ap. Ph. 1.26; παῖς, μ., νεανίσκος Arr. Epict. 3.9.8; under twenty-one, Plu. Brut. 27; about twenty, Luc. DMort. 19[9].4; ἐκ μειρακίων μέχρι γήρως Isoc. 15.93, cf. Aeschin. 1.39; εἰς ἄνδρας ἐκ μειρακίων τελευτᾶν Pl. Tht. 173b; ἐκ μειρακίου Is. 5.40.

data.quote: ἄχρι γενείου λαχνώσιος, ἐς τὰ τρὶς ἑπτά

children.definition: Plb. 2.68.2, Plu. Phil. 6.
Dim. of μεῖραξ, little girl, Ar. Ra. 411 (lyr.), and (in iron. sense) Pl. 963.
Dim. of μεῖραξ, lad, stripling, Alex. 36.2, 178.7, Men. Georg. 4, Satyr. Vit.Eur.Fr. 39 xii 26, Jul. Or. 7.223c; ἦν δὴ παῖς μᾶλλον δὲ μ. Pl. Phdr. 237b.

data.quote: ἦν δὴ παῖς μᾶλλον δὲ μ.

children.definition: becoming a youth, youthful, παιδεία Pl. R. 498b: τὸ μ., of style, foppish, affected, D.H. Isoc. 12, cf. Pomp. 2, Longin. 3.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: characteristic of youth, δόξα Pl. R. 466b; ὑπερβολαί Arist. Rh. 1413a29; βίος τῶν ἀσώτων Ph. 1.678. Adv. -δῶς Plb. 11.14.7, Phld. Mus. p.109 K.: Comp. - έστερον Din. Fr. 66.
boyishness, Theognost. Can. 26.
Dim. of μειράκιον, stripling, Ar. Ra. 89, Anaxandr. 33.12, Men. Fab.inc. 2.33, Luc. Par. 43; μ. ὢν κομιδῇ D. 21.78:—also μειρᾰκῐωδ-υλλίδιον, v.l. in Lib. Ref. 1.11.

young girl, lass (cf. Phryn. 187), Cratin. 301, Ar. Th. 410, Ec. 611, Pl. 1071, 1079, Xenarch. 4.3, Men. Pk. 14: used as fem. of men, qui muliebria patiuntur, Cratin. 55, Luc. Sol. 5: in later writers masc., boy, lad, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.109, Aret. SD 1.13, Hld. 4.19. (Cf. Skt. maryakás ‘manikin’, máryas ‘young man’.)

definition: μείρομαι (A), Hes. Op. 578 ( ἀπο-), imper. μείρεο Il. 9.616; elsewh. in Hom. and Hes. only 3 sg. ἔμμορε (which is prob. aor. (v. infr. II) and was so understood by later Ep. Poets, who have 2 sg. ἔμμορες A.R. 3.4; 3 pl. ἔμμορον cited by EM 335.24, ἐξ-έμμορον Nic. Th. 791: but pf. 3 pl. ἐμμόραντι· τετεύχασι Hsch.); we also have (as if from μορέω) fut. μορήσω EM 335.23: pf. μεμόρηκα Nic. Al. 213; for pass. forms v. infr. III:—

children.definition: receive as oneʼs portion, with collat. notion of its being oneʼs due: c. acc., καὶ ἥμισυ μείρεο τιμῆς take half the honour as thy due, Il. l.c.; later, divide, ἀροτήσιον ὥρην τριπλόα μείρονται Arat. 1054.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἔμμορε ( ἔμμορες, etc.), obtain oneʼs share of, c. gen., οὔ ποθʼ ὁμοίης ἔμμορε τιμῆς Il. 1.278; πάντα δέδασται, ἕκαστος δʼ ἔμμορε τιμῆς 15.189, cf. Od. 11.338; θεῶν ἒξ ἔμμορε τιμῆς 5.335; ἔμμορέ τοι τιμῆς ὅς τʼ ἔμμορε γείτονος ἐσθλοῦ Hes. Op. 347; ἐν δὲ διχοστασίῃ καὶ ὁ πάγκακος ἔμμορε τιμῆς Call. Fr.anon. 373 [not in P.?]: later c. acc., A.R. 3.208, Nic. Al. 488.

data.quote: πάντα δέδασται, ἕκαστος δʼ ἔμμορε τιμῆς
ἔμμορέ τοι τιμῆς ὅς τʼ ἔμμορε γείτονος ἐσθλοῦ
ἐν δὲ διχοστασίῃ καὶ ὁ πάγκακος ἔμμορε τιμῆς

children.definition: part., like τυγχάνω, happen to be, νόημα . . μεμόρηκε . . ἐσφαλμένον ib. 213.

children.label: III
children.definition: pf. Pass. εἵμαρται, inf. εἱμάρθαι B. 13.1, App. BC 2.4: impers., it is allotted, decreed by fate, εὖ εἱμάρθαι παρὰ δαίμονος B. l.c.: usu. c. acc. et inf., Pl. R. 566a, Phdr. 255b: freq. in plpf. εἵμαρτο it was decreed, νῦν δέ με λευγαλέῳ θανάτῳ εἵμαρτο ἁλῶναι Il. 21.281; ἐκ γὰρ τῆς εἵμαρτο . . τέκνα γενέσθαι Hes. Th. 894; εἰ . . οὕτως εἵμαρτο πρᾶξαι D. 18.195, etc.: freq. also in part., θεῶν εἱμαρμένα δῶρα Thgn. 1033; τὰ δʼ ἄλλα . . σὺν θεοῖς εἱμαρμένα A. Ag. 913; τοιαῦτα . . πρὸς θεῶν εἱμ. S. Tr. 169; χρόνος εἱμαρμένος Pl. Prt. 320d, cf. Phd. 113a; εἴπερ εἱμαρμένον εἴη Id. Mx. 243e; ἡ εἱμαρμένη (sc. μοῖρα) destiny, Id. Phd. 115a, Grg. 512e, D. 18.205, etc.: later forms μέμορται Phot., Suid.: inf. μέμορθαι Aeol. acc. to Sch. Il. 10.67, EM 312.46: part. μεμορμένος, θάνατος, οἶκος, A.R. 3.1130, Epigr.Gr. 414.7 ( Egypt); ἠρίον Alex.Aet. 3.33; πότμος Lyc. 430; κῆρες AP 7.700 ( Diod.); τὸ μ. Plu. Mar. 39, Agath. 1.1 (v.l. μεμαρμένον): Aeol. ἐμμόρμενον Alc. Supp. 14.7: Dor. ἐμβρᾰμένα (q.v.); βεβρᾰμένων· εἱμαρμένων, Hsch.; μεμόρηται Man. 6.13; μεμορημένος AP 7.466 ( Leon.); but μεμορημένον in Nic. Al. 229 is from μορέω (q.v.); Dor. 3 sg. μεμόρακται (as if from μοράζω) it receives a portion of, τινος Ti.Locr. 95a.

data.quote: νῦν δέ με λευγαλέῳ θανάτῳ εἵμαρτο ἁλῶναι
ἐκ γὰρ τῆς εἵμαρτο . . τέκνα γενέσθαι
τὰ δʼ ἄλλα . . σὺν θεοῖς εἱμαρμένα

children.label: IV
children.definition: μείρομαι as Pass., to be divided from, τινος Arat. 657.
Nic. Th. 402, Inscr.Perg. 203.

definition: μείς, μηνός, ὁ, nom. sg. μείς Il. 19.117, Hes. Op. 557, h.Merc. 11, Anacr. 6.1, Pi. N. 5.44, Hdt. 2.82, Hp. Septim. 3 (v.l.), Pl. Cra. 409c, Ti. 39c, Arist. GA 777b23, Thphr. Sign. 27, Call. Hec. Fr. 260.12 Pf. [updated ref.], SIG 1009. 27 ( Chalcedon, iii/ii B.C.), 1047.46 ( Amorgos, ii/i B.C.), IG 9(1).682 (Corc., iv B. C.), Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.199, Eudox. Ars Prooem. , 13.1, Ezek. Exag. 153, Str. 13.1.64, Sammelb. 1191; Dor. μής SIG 243 D 45 ( Delph., iv B. C.), IG 42(1).102.10 ( Epid., iv B. C.), 42.6 (iii B. C.), Tab.Heracl. 1.1; Elean μεύς Schwyzer 418.15: nom. sg. μήν Hes. Fr. 240 codd., IG 1(2).377.14, al. (v B. C.), 387.32 (v B. C.), Th. 5.54, X. HG 4.5.1, 7.4.28, LXX 1 Ki. 20.24, al., SIG 672.85 ( Delph., ii B. C.); both μείς and μήν in Thphr. Sign. 27: oblique cases formed from stem μην-, Aeol. μηνν- IG 12(2).6.39, al. (Mytil.), Thess. μεινν- ib. 9(2).258.5 ( Cierium); dat. pl. μησί Hdt. 4.43, 8.51 (v.l. μήνεσἱν)), Pl. Lg. 771b, μησίν SIG 45.18 ( Halic., v B. C.):—

children.definition: month, Il. l.c., etc.; τοῦ μὲν φθίνοντος μηνός, τοῦ δʼ ἱσταμένοιο Od. 14.162, cf. Hes. Op. 780, Th. 59; ἱσταμένου τοῦ μ. εἰνάτη Hdt. 6.106, cf. Th. 4.52, etc.; μηνὸς τετάρτῃ φθίνοντος on the fourth day from the end of the month, Foed. ap. eund. 5.19; Μαιμακτηριῶνος δεκάτῃ ἀπιόντος, i.e. on the 21st, Decr. ap. D. 18.37; μηνῶν φθινὰς ἁμέρα the last of the month, E. Heracl. 779 (lyr.); τελευτῶντος τοῦ μηνός at the end of the lunar month (when there was no moon-light), Th. 2.4; ἐκείνου τοῦ μηνός in the course of . . , X. Mem. 4.8.2; κατὰ μῆνα monthly, Ar. Nu. 1287, etc.; μισθὸν διδόναι κατὰ μ. D. 50.10; κατὰ μῆνα ἕκαστον, κατὰ μῆνας, Pl. Lg. 830d, 762b; ἐκάστου μηνός ib. 760d; τοῦ μηνὸς ἑκάστου Ar. Ach. 859 (lyr.); τοῦ μηνός alone, by the month, Id. Nu. 612, etc.; συνόδους ποιεῖσθαι δύο τοῦ μ. Pl. Lg. 771d; τόκον δραχμὴν τοῦ μ. τῆς μνᾶς interest a drachma per mina per month, Aeschin. 3.104; μ. πλήρης, κοῖλος, civil month of 30 or 29 days respectively, Gem. 8.3; μ. ἐμβόλιμος intercalary month, Hdt. 1.32, IG 12(7).237.56 ( Arcesine), Eudox. Ars 13.13.

data.quote: τοῦ μὲν φθίνοντος μηνός, τοῦ δʼ ἱσταμένοιο

children.definition: crescent moon, Thphr. l.c. ( μείς); the part of the month corresponding to a phase of the moon, ibid. ( μείς and μήν); the visible part of the moon, Chrysipp. l.c. ( μείς).
ornament in form of crescent moon, IG 1(2).387.32 ( v B. C., μήν).

children.label: b
children.definition: Ar. Av. 1115, cf. Cleom. 2.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: Lunus, masc. of Μήνη, Luc. JTr. 8. (I.-E. stem mēns- ‘moon’, ‘month’, cf. Lat. mensis, gen. pl. mensum, etc.)

definition: μεῖστος, η, ον, Sup. of μείων,

children.definition: least, Hsch., EM 676.14, Eust. 134.45, Sch. Ar. Pl. 627: neut. as Adv., μεῖστον at least, Berl.Sitzb. 1927.8 ( Locr., V B.C.). (From μέy-ιστος.)

definition: μεῖχμα, ατος, τό, Aeol. for μεῖγμα, dub. in Alc. Supp. 13.7.

children.definition: curtailment: hence, fine, X. An. 5.8.1.

definition: μείων, so in Dor., Leg.Gort. 9.48, al., Schwyzer 323 B 9 ( Delph., iv B. C.), Tab.Heracl. 1.114, al., Archyt. 1, prob. in Epich. 62 ( μηονος cod., and so in Diotog. ap. Stob. 4.7.62, etc.), and Arc., IG 5(2).3.15, 18 ( Tegea): neut. pl. μείονα Hes. Op. 690, but μείω Ti.Locr. 102b: masc. pl. μείους Xenoph. 3.4, etc.: dat. pl. μειόνοις IG 9(1).333 ( Locr.):

children.definition: Comp. of ὀλίγος or μικρός, lesser, less, Pi. O. 1.35, al., A. Ch. 519, B. 1.63, etc.; τὸ μ. κρεισσόνων κρατύνει; A. Supp. 596 (lyr.), cf. Hp. VM 8 (v.l., cf. Erot.), Vict. 1.5, al. (not in other works of Hp.), freq. in X., Cyr. 5.4.48, al., not in good Att. Prose or Com., nor in Hdt.; younger, S. OC 374: neut. μεῖον as Adv., less, μ. ἰσχύσειν Διός A. Pr. 510, cf. Ch. 707: regul. Adv., μειόνως ἔχειν to be of less value, S. OC 104, cf. J. AJ 19.2.2:—also μειότερος, α, ον, A.R. 2.368, Arat. 43, AP 14.41, Man. 2.147, IG 14.2064. ( μεί-y ων, cf. μινύθω, Lat. minuo, minus.)
with a smaller denominator, of fractions, Iamb. in Nic. p.48 P. ( Comp.).

diminution, opp. αὔξησις, αἱ τῶν ὀστέων μ. Hp. Mochl. 24, cf. Arist. Cat. 15a14, GC 320b31, Thphr. CP 4.4.11, Phld. Oec. p.68 J. (pl.), Alex.Aphr. in Top. 111.4: voc. μείωσι Orph. H. 13.7; of the moon, waning, Cleom. 2.5, Placit. 3.17.3, Arr. Epict. 1.14.4, Gal. 9.905; loss of property, etc., Vett.Val. 44.14 (pl.), al.
one must lessen, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 5.27.17.
causing diminution, ἀστὴρ μ. τῶν προκτηθέντων Paul.Al. N. 4.
lowering in description, diminishing, ὕψους Longin. 42.1; ὑπαρχόντων Vett.Val. 10.20; ποταμῶν Heph.Astr. 1.20: Medic., πλήθους (plethora) Gal. 1.146; waning, τὸ τῆς σελήνης μ. σχῆμα Vett.Val. 41.6.
depreciatory, Phld. Rh. 1.217 S. Adv. -κῶς S.E. M. 3.42, D.L. 7.53.
capable of diminution, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.10.15.

definition: μελάγγαιος, ον, Hdt. 2.12, 4.198; μελάγ-γειος, ον, Dicaearch. 1.12, Thphr. HP 8.7.2, BGU 1529 ( Ptol.), Antyll. ap. Orib. 9.11.6; μελαγ-γέως, ων, gen. ω, Thphr. CP 2.4.12:—

children.definition: with black soil, Hdt., Thphr. ll. cc.; πόλις μ. τῇ χρόᾳ Dicaearch. l.c.
marked with black, διφθέραι prob. for μελεγγρ- in E. Fr. 627.

black-horned, of Agamemnon, A. Ag. 1127 (lyr., the epith. being suggested by the preceding words, ἄπεχε τῆς βοὸς τὸν ταῦρον): but cod. Med. is corrected to μελαγκέρῳ ( = μέλανι) agreeing with μηχανήματι.
shrouded in gloom, εἴδωλον B. Fr. 25; carrying darkness (i.e. dark rain) in its bosom, νέφος Id. 3.55 (prob.l.).
black-bosomed, Nonn. D. 34.83.
black-haired, Poll. 2.24.
pipe like the μελαγκόρυφος, Hero Spir. 2.32.

blackcap warbler, Motacilla atricapilla, or a kind of titmouse, Ar. Av. 887, Arist. HA 592b22, 616b4; αἱ συκαλίδες καὶ οἱ μ. . . μεταβάλλουσιν εἰς ἀλλήλους ib. 632b31, cf. Plin. HN 10.86, Gp. 15.1.23.
black-haired, Ἀσάφεια Emp. 122.4 ( v.l. - καρπος).
black-haired, of the Sibyl, Lyc. 1464, Arist. Mir. 838a9.
plaited of rushes, Philet. 17.2; σφενδόναι Str. 3.5.1 (- κραϊν- codd. in both places).
black bog-rush, Schoenus nigricans, Thphr. HP 4.12.1 ( μελαγκράνισμα, μελαγκρανισμόν codd.), Plin. HN 21.113. (Fort. proparox.)
with black shoes, Eust. 174.9, 1437.53.
with black woof: with black sails, [ ναῦς] A. Th. 857 (lyr.).
with black handle, Sch. E. Or. 821.
black-haired, of Centaurs, Hes. Sc. 186, S. Tr. 837 (lyr.); of Hades, E. Alc. 439 (lyr.).

black, dark, γυῖα, στρατός, A. Supp. 719, 745 (lyr.); φάρη Id. Ch. 11; πέπλοι, οἶς, E. Ph. 372, El. 513; νύξ A. Pers. 301; τὰ μ. dark spots in snow, X. Cyn. 8.1, cf. Poll. 5.66.— For the form cf. δύσχιμος.
with black raiment: hence, metaph., darksome, gloomy, φρήν A. Pers. 115 (lyr.).
black-cloaked, Mosch. 3.27 (glossed by διαυγής, Hsch.).

children.label: II
children.definition: οἱ M., as pr. n. of a Scythian tribe, Hdt. 4.20, etc.
dark olive-coloured, sallow, v.l. in Hp. Epid. 6.2.19, prob. in Arist. Phgn. 812a19, cf. Gal. 13.460, Vett.Val. 111.9, Aret. SD 2.1; χροιή ib. 1.5; χολή ib. 15.
to be atrabilious, melancholy-mad, Ar. Av. 14, Pl. 12, 366, 903, Pl. Phdr. 268e, D. 48.56, Alex. 211, Men. Sam. 218, Gal. 1.500, etc.
atrabiliousness, melancholy, freq. in pl., Hp. Aër. 10, Ti.Locr. 103a, Phld. Ir. p.28 W., Man. 2.366: sg., Aret. SD 1.5.
of atrabilious or melancholic temperament, τὰ μ. Hp. Aph. 3.20; οἱ μ. ib. 4.9; opp. πικρόχολος, Id. Acut. 61. Adv. -κῶς Id. Prorrh. 1.14, Coac. 92, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: atrabilious, impulsive, Pl. R. 573c, Arist. EN 1152a19.
dipped in black bile, ἰοί S. Tr. 573.
like black bile, Aret. SD 1.15.

definition: μελάγχροος, ον, contr. μελάγ-χρους, ουν, heterocl. nom. pl. μελάγχροες Hdt. 2.104:—

children.definition: black-skinned, swarthy, of sunburnt persons, Hp. Epid. 6.2.19, PPetr. 3pp. 1,19 (iii B. C.), Plu. Arat. 20, etc.; μ. κόσσυφος Numen. ap. Ath. 7.315b:—also μελαγχροιής, ές, of a heroʼs complexion, Od. 16.175; μέλαγχρος, ον, as pr. n., Alc. 21; μελάγχρως, ωτος, ὁ, ἡ, E. Or. 321 (lyr.), Hec. 1106 (lyr., v.l. μελανό-), Pl. Phdr. 253e, PPetr. 3p.19, al. (iii B. C.), etc.:—Com. μελαγχρής, ές, Cratin. 425, Eup. 430, Antiph. 135, Men. 974, Anon.Iamb. in Gerhard Phoinix p.7, also PCair.Zen. 76.9 (iii B. C.); μ. μᾶζα Polioch. 2.2.

definition: μελάθρα, ἡ, = sq. 1, IG ΙΙ(2).146 A 64 ( Delos, iv B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: = sq. II.1, Hermesian. 7.21 cod.

definition: μέλαθρον, τό, Ep. gen. sg. μελαθρόφιν Od. 8.279:—

children.definition: roof-tree, ridgepole, μελαθρόφιν ἐξεκέχυντο l.c., cf. 11.278, h.Ven. 173, IG ΙΙ(2).161 A 105 ( Delos, iii B. C.), 199 A 113 (ibid., pl.); ἐπὶ προὔχοντι μελάθρῳ Od. 19.544: generally, beam, LXX 3 Ki. 7.9(20); τὰ μ. τῶν θυρίδων PRyl. 233.5 (ii A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: house, κυπαρίσσινον μ. Pi. P. 5.40; οὐράνιον μ., of heaven, E. Hec. 1101 (lyr.): mostly in pl., Alc. Supp. 19.2, etc.; μ. ἐν βασιλείοις in the kingʼs halls, A. Ch. 343 (anap.), etc.; ἐς δόμων μ. Id. Ag. 957; of a cave used as a dwelling, S. Ph. 147, E. Cyc. 491 (both anap.).
lair of an animal, Opp. C. 2.307.
cage, ib. 4.107, 423. (Acc. to EM 576.16 from μελαίνω, cf. καπνοδόκη; it is doubtful whether κμέλεθρον is cogn.)
connect or fasten by beams, LXX 3 Ki. 7.42(5) ( Pass.).
a blackish fish, Cratin. 161.
the black, a name of Aphrodite at Corinth, Ath. 13.588c.

children.label: II
children.definition: sea-shell, used as a drinking-cup, Sophr. 101, Herod. 1.79; = πελωρίς, Xenocr. ap. Orib. 2.58.97.

children.label: III
children.definition: μελαῖνις (sic) αἲξ καὶ βοῦς from Melaenae, Diosc.Gloss. ap. Gal. 19.120.
accompanied by black clouds, of sunset and sunrise, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(1).138.

definition: μελαινόρινες, f.l. for κελαινόρινες in S. Fr. 29.

μελαίνω ( Act. not in Hom. or Hes.), aor. 1 inf. μελᾶναι Arist. Mete. 371a23:— Pass., pf. μεμέλαμμαι Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.36.1: aor. ἐμελάνθην S. Aj. 919; Ep. 3 pl. μελάνθησαν Hes. Sc. 300: ( μέλας):—

children.definition: blacken, make black, Arist. l.c., Pr. 966b22, Nic. Al. 472: metaph., μ. φράσιν use an obscure expression, Ath. 10.451c; μ. τὸ σαφές D.H. Pomp. 2:— Pass., μελαίνετο δὲ χρόα καλόν she had her fair skin stained black (i.e. with blood), Il. 5.354; μελανθὲν αἷμα S. l.c., cf. Gal. 18(1).33; of earth just turned up, ἡ δὲ μελαίνετʼ ὄπισθεν Il. 18.548; of ripening grapes, Hes. l.c.; of a newly-bearded chin, ib. 167; αἱ λευκαὶ τρίχες ἐμελαίνοντο Pl. Plt. 270e; of hair, to be dyed black, Ar. Ec. 736; μεμελαμμένοι ὀδόντες Antyll. l.c.
cause μελασμός (q. v.), Hp. Aph. 5.20:— Pass., turn black, as a symptom of mortification, Id. Art. 69, Fract. 11.
blacken, misrepresent, Simp. in Cael. 290.24.
Pass., receive an impression of blackness, S.E. M. 7.293.

children.label: II
children.definition: = Pass., grow black, Pl. Ti. 83a, Thphr. Ign. 50, AP 5.123 ( Phld.), Plu. Curios. 2.517c.
darkly deep, Ταρτάρου κευθμών A. Pr. 221; ἀκταὶ Ἀχέροντος S. Fr. 523 ( v.l. - βαφεῖς) ; σηκὸς δράκοντος E. Ph. 1010 ( v.l. - βαφής) ; εἴδωλον v.l. in B. Fr. 25; cf. μελαγκευθής.
dark-dyed, Poll. 7.129; cf. foreg.
of dark and dreary life, Hsch.
having black oxen, Eust. 562.39.
of the black north: πνεῦμα μ. the black north wind in Southern Gaul and Palestine, Str. 4.1.7, J. BJ 3.9.3.
of negroes, E. Fr. 228.3; γείτονες μ. negroes, ib. 771.4.
with black soil, Αἴγυπτος AP 6.231 ( Phil.), cf. Opp. C. 3.508.
black-clotted, αἷμα A. Th. 737 (lyr.): generally, black, discoloured, [ χαλκὸς] μ. πέλει Id. Ag. 392 (lyr.).
black-robed, epith. of Death, and Night, E. Alc. 843, Ion 1150, Alex. 89; dark, black, στολή E. Alc. 427, cf. 819.
dark-leaved, κλών AP 4.1.14 ( Mel.), 9.307 ( Phil.).
with a garment embroidered with black leaves, γόνατα Tim. Pers. 134.
with black rocks, Philet. 24.
festival of Melampus at Aegosthena, IG 7.223.22 (ii B. C.):
sanctuary of Melampus at Aegosthena, IG 7.207, 208.
Thphr. HP 9.10.4.
dark purple, Poll. 4.119.

definition: μελάμπους, ὁ, ἡ, πουν, τό, gen. ποδος,

children.definition: black-footed, ancient epith. of the Egyptians, Apollod. 2.1.4, Eust. 37.23: in Hom. only as pr. n., Blackfoot.
with black prow, ναῦς Hymn.Is. 146.

black-bottomed, considered a mark of manhood, Eub. 61; a name of Heracles, μ. τοῖς ἐχθροῖς a very Heracles to them, Ar. Lys. 802 (lyr.), cf. Hdt. 7.216: prov., μή τευ μ. τύχης take care not to ‘catch a Tartar’, Archil. 110.
ball-mustard, Neslia paniculata, Thphr. HP 8.4.6, Gal. 6.552 (also μελάμ-πῡρος, ὁ, Thphr. HP 8.8.3).
whose light is blackness, μελαμφαὲς οἴχεται διʼ Ἔρεβος E. Hel. 518 (lyr.); γαίας ἐς μ. μυχούς Carc. 5.3.
with dark shroud, δκότος B. 3.13.
dark-leaved, δάφνα Anacr. 78 (= 92 Diehl, perh. pr. n.); δάφναι Theoc. Ep. 1.3; κισσός D.P. 573; of places, dark with leaves, Αἴτνας κορυφαί Pi. P. 1.27; γῆ S. OC 482; ὄρη Ar. Th. 997 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. μελάμφυλλον, τό, = ἄκανθος, Dsc. 3.17, Gal. 11.818.
with indistinct voice, Gal. 5.384.
with black pebbles, of streams, Call. Dian. 101, Del. 76.
wine made from black ψίθιος, Dsc. 5.6, Orib. Fr. 64.
with black spots, ἵπποι PWis. 16 in Aegyptus 9.244 (ii A. D.).
ink, Pl. Phdr. 276c; τὸ μ. τρίβων D. 18.258, cf. Herod. 5.66, etc.; μ. γραφικόν Dsc. 1.69; used of a drawing material capable of erasure, Procl. Hyp. 3.72.
μ. Ἰνδικόν indigo, Peripl.M.Rubr. 39.

children.label: II
children.definition: iris of the eye, Arist. HA 491b21.

children.label: b
children.definition: cornea, Gal. 14.772.
PMag.Par. 1.403.
vitis nigra agrestis, Gloss.: - άγριος, malva agrestis, ib.
black eagle, Arist. HA 618b28.
dark kind of summer-wheat, Gp. 3.3.11 (- αίθηρ Hsch.).
with dark aegis, epith. of Erinys, A. Th. 699 (lyr.); of Dionysus at Athens, Paus. 2.35.1, Sch. Ar. Ach. 146.—On the accent v. Hdn.Gr. 1.85.

children.label: II
children.definition: οἶνος] μ. dark red wine, Plu. QConv. 2.692f.
the part of a ship covered with pitch, Ar. Fr. 817.
dark-gleaming, νασμός E. Hec. 153 (anap.), cf. Orph. A. 513.

definition: μελάνδειρος, ὁ, a small bird, Hsch.

children.definition: bound or mounted with black, φάσγανα καλὰ μελάνδετα Il. 15.713; μ. ξίφος with iron scabbard, E. Ph. 1091; σάκος μ. iron-rimmed shield, A. Th. 43; but μελάνδετον φόνῳ ξίφος E. Or. 821 (lyr.).
dark-eddying, Γάγγης D.P. 577.
holding ink, κίστη, ἄγγος μ., AP 6.65 ( Paul.Sil.), 68 (Jul.Aeg.).
inkstand, Gloss.
heart of oak, Thphr. HP 1.6.2.
dark as the oak, dark-leaved, πίτυς A. Fr. 251, cf. Sch. Od. 14.12.

a large kind of tunny, Pamphil. ap. Ath. 3.121b:—hence μελάνδρυα (sc. τεμάχη), τά, cheap cuts of tunny, Xenocr. ap. Orib. 2.58.146 (said to resemble black oak-roots, cf. Plin. HN 9.48); and μελανδρύαι (sc. τόμοι), οἱ, Ath. l.c., 7.315e.
look black, Gal. 19.156.
to be clad in black, Arist. Mir. 840b7, Scymn. 401, IPE 12.34.24 ( Olbia, i B. C.), Str. 11.11.8, J. BJ 4.4.3, Plu. VOrat. 2.838f, Lib. Or. 30.8.
wearing of black robes, Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.161.
black-clad, μ. ἔφοδοι the assaults of the black-robed ones (the Furies), A. Eu. 375 (lyr.); μ. ἑορτή a public lamentation, D.H. 2.19, cf. Plb. 2.16.13, J. AJ 16.8.6; cf. μελανοείμων.
blackly dark, EM 370.19.
with black girdle, Nonn. D. 31.116.
Orph. H. 42.9; epith. of priests of Isis, at Delos, SIG 977a2 (ii B. C.); at Eretria, Ἀρχ.Δελτ. 1.148:— hence μελᾰνη-φορέω, Tz. H. 7.999.
λευκοθέα, Aristo Stoic. 1.86.
oil of μελάνθιον, Dsc. 1.37 (marg.).

definition: μελάνθεμον, τό, v.l. for μηλάνθεμον, Dsc. 3.137.

children.definition: black, swarthy, γένος, A. Supp. 154 (lyr.); μ. ῥοίζῳ σπερχόμενος πόντος Hymn.Is. 150.
made from μελάνθιον, Dsc. 1.37, Gal. 11.870.

a herb whose seeds were used as spice, black cummin, Nigella sativa, Hp. Mul. 1.74, Steril. 230, LXX Is. 28.27, Dsc. 3.79, POxy. 1088.16 (i A. D.), PMag.Par. 1.919, Gp. 13.4.2, al.: gen. μελανθέου PStrassb. 102.8 (iii B. C.); μελανθείου (with v.l. μελανθείης) Nic. Th. 43; μελανθύου PCair.Zen. 292.325, cf. 20 (iii B. C.): dat. μελανθείῳ PTeb. 69.25 (ii B. C.).
Arist. Phgn. 808a19.

blackness, opp. λευκότης, Arist. Ph. 264b8, Metaph. 1020b10, Str. 12.8.18, etc.; μ. τῆς μορφῆς, of negroes, Agatharch. 16; μ. οὐλῶν Dsc. 1.34; μ. ἐκ τόκου Crito ap. Gal. 12.447: in pl., Hierocl. p.35 A.

children.label: II
children.definition: black cloud, X. An. 1.8.8 in pl., black spots, Plb. 1.81.7.
black pigment, Thphr. HP 5.3.1.
festival of Dionysus Μέλας, dub. in SIG 1025.58 ( Cos, iv/iii B. C.).
to be black or blackish, Hices. ap. Ath. 7.320d, Dsc. 1.105, Gp. 9.17.1:— Pass., Heliod. ap. Orib. 50.7.2.
Dim. of μέλαν, ink, PMag. Par. 1.2013 (pl.), PMag.Berol. 1.243a.
with black horses, νύξ A. Fr. 69.5 (lyr.).
dark in colour, οἶνος Hp. Mul. 1.42 (s. v. l.).
Hsch.
Nic. Th. 566.
with black stripes, Arist. Fr. 298.
black-skinned, Arist. HA 517a14.
inkstand, Aq. Ez. 9.2:—also μελᾰνο-δόχον, Poll. 10.60; and μελᾰνο-δόκον, PLond. 2.402v25 (ii B. C.).
black-looking, Arist. Col. 795a33.
Hp. Insomn. 92 (v.l. μελανείμ-), Vett.Val. 2.5.
darkish, ὦτα Aret. SD 2.13 (s. v. l.).
black benched, i. e. manned with swarthy ( Egyptian) rowers, μ. ἄτα A. Supp. 530 (lyr.).[accentuation edited HD]
black-haired, Hp. Epid. 1.19, Arist. GA 786a25.[accentuation edited HD]
black-hearted, Στυγὸς πέτρα Ar. Ra. 470.

definition: μελανοκιοεργός, dub. sens. in Tab.Defix.Aud. 255 ( Carthage, i A. D.).

children.definition: dark-bosomed, Νύξ prob. for μεγαλόκολπος in B. Fr. 23.

definition: μελανοκόμης, v.l. for μελαγκόμης in Poll. 2.24.

children.definition: black-limbed, Zonar.
black-fleeced, Eust. 403.42.
black-eyed, Pl. Phdr. 253d, Arist. GA 779b14.
clad in black shroud, Com. word in Ar. Ra. 1336 (lyr.).
with black clouds, gloss on κελαινεφής, Sch. D Il. 2.412.
to be or become black, pf. Pass. μεμελάνωμαι LXX Jb. 30.30, Aët. 16.75.
black-haired, Sch. Pi. O. 6.46.
blackening, Hsch. s.v. μελαινάων.
black-footed, gloss on κυανόπεζα, Sch. D Il. 11.628.
black-winged, φάσμα E. Hec. 705 (lyr.); Νύξ Ar. Av. 695; ἀλεκτορίδες Gp. 14.7.9.
= foreg., ὄνειρος E. Hec. 71 (anap.); with black fins, κορακῖνοι Ar. Fr. 537.
having black horses, Sch. E. Ph. 606.
with black stripes, Xenocr. ap. Orib. 2.58.107.
black hellebore, Ps.- Dsc. 4.162.
Gp. 7.15.6, Stad. 57: neut. μελανόν, τό, black pigment, Sammelb. 2251 (iv A. D.).
dark mole-coloured, ἵππος PPetr. 3p.159 (iii B. C.).
black-eyed, v.l. (ap. Sch.) in Il. 21.252; cf. μελάνοστος.
black-skinned, A. Fr. 370 ( μελαστ- cod. L, fort. μελανστ-).
black-spotted, Arist. Fr. 299.
black-robed, Plu. Isid. 2.372e; epith. of Isis, Epigr.Gr. 1023.3 ( Egypt).
black-boned, αἰετοῦ . . μελανόστου θηρητῆρος read for μέλανος τοῦ in Il. 21.252 by Aristotle (cf. Sch. BT, Eust. 1235.42); cf. μελάνοσσος.

definition: μελανοσυρμαῖος, ον, epith. of Egyptians in Ar. Th. 857, with a double meaning,

children.definition: with black trains to their robes ( σύρματα), and fond of purges ( συρμαῖαι).
blackness, opp. λευκότης, Arist. Ph. 244b17.
atramentarius, Gloss.

definition: μελανουρίς, ίδος, pecul. fem. of sq., AP 6.304 ( Phan.).

children.definition: black-tail, Oblata melanura, Epich. 56, Cratin. 221, Antiph. 194.4, Arist. HA 591a15, Speus. ap. Ath. 7.313e, Numen.ib.d; μὴ γεύεσθαι μελανούρων Pythag. ap. Plu. Lib.educ. 2.12d.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ael. NA 6.51.
dark grey, opp. λευκόφ-, of figs, Ath. 3.78a.
black-eyed, Hp. Epid. 1.19, Arist. GA 779a35, Philostr. Gym. 25, Gp. 17.2.1.
black-veined, Aret. SD 2.1.
wear black, Plu. Vind. 2.557d.
wearing black, Sch. E. Ph. 324.
black- or beetle-browed, Hdn.Gr. 1.237, Hsch.
Chaerem. 14.13.
Procl. Par.Ptol. 204.

Od. 19.246: heterocl. nom. pl. κύαμοι μελανόχροες Il. 13.589: gen. sg. - χροος Nic. Th. 941: acc. sg. - χροα Orph. L. 363: contr. μελᾰνό-χρους PLond. 2.333.23 (ii A. D.):—also μελανοχροιής, Suid.; μελᾰνό-χρως, ωτος, ὁ, ἡ, = μελάγχρως, E. Hec. 1106 (lyr., as v.l.), Arist. Phgn. 808a17, Theoc. 3.35; μελανόχρων Thphr. Sens. 78.
a becoming black, opp. λεύκανσις Arist. Ph. 227b8, 230a23.
dyeing black, τριχῶν Alex.Trall. 1.3.
Dsc. Eup. 2.97.
black-breasted, Jo.Gaz. 2.126.
black-walled, δόμος Φερσεφόνας Pi. O. 14.20.

black pigment, also used internally as a drug, Lat. creta sutoria, shoemakers’ black, IG 2(2).1672.14,16,69, Arist. Col. 794a20, Heraclid.Tar. ap. Cael.Aur. CP 3.44, Dsc. 5.101, Gal. 13.741, Luc. Cat. 15, Scrib.Larg. 208.
spot, stain, Sch. E. Hec. 912.
black when eaten, σῦκον AP 6.299 ( Phan.).
with black water, κρήνη μελάνυδρος, of water which looks black from its depth, Il. 9.14, Od. 20.158, Thgn. 959.

grow black, only in Il. 7.64 Ζεφύροιο ἐχεύατο πόντον ἔπι φρίξ . . , μελάνει δέ τε πόντος ὑπʼ αὐτῆς (sc. τῆς φρικός), cf. Arist. Pr. 934a15; but Aristarch. read πόντον in the second clause and took μελάνει trans., = μελαίνει (sc. Ζέφυρος), makes the sea black:—later writers use μελανέω, intr. (which implies the reading μελανεῖ δέ τε πόντος), Thphr. Ign. 50, A.R. 4.1574, Arat. 836; τὸ καλὸν μελανεῦντα Call. Epigr. 53; μικκὴ καὶ μελανεῦσα AP 5.120 ( Phld.).
black-looking, σηπεδών Marc.Sid. 64.
black-skinned, Nonn. D. 14.395, al.

definition: μέλας ( μέλᾰς Rhian. 58, where μέγας is corrupt for μέλας) , μέλαινα, μέλᾰν; gen. μέλᾰνος, μελαίνης, μέλᾰνος, etc.; Ep. dat. μείλανι (metri gr.) Il. 24.79: Aeol. nom. μέλαις, from *μέλανς, Choerob. in Theod. 1.123, Greg.Cor. p.599 S., hence restored in Sapph. 57:—

children.definition: black, dark: in Hom. generally, dark in colour, οἶνος Od. 5.265; μέλαν αἷμα, κῦμα, Il. 4.149, 23.693; γαῖα μέλαινα 2.699, cf. Sapph. Supp. 5.2; ὕδωρ μέλαν Αἰσήποιο Il. 2.825, cf. Od. 4.359, νηῦς μ., from its being pitched over, Il. 1.300, al.; of men, dark, swarthy, μέλανας δὲ ἀνδρικοὺς ἰδεῖν Pl. R. 474e; ἰσχυρός τις ἦν, μ. D. 21.71; τὰ μ. black marks about the ears of dogs, X. Cyn. 5.23.

children.label: II
children.definition: dark, murky, ἕσπερος Od. 1.423; εὐφρόνα Pi. N. 7.3.

children.label: III
children.definition: black, dark, θάνατος Il. 2.834, etc.; κήρ ib. 859, etc.; ὀδύναι 4.117, etc. (the origin of the metaphor is seen in the phrases θανάτου μ. νέφος, ἄχεος νεφέλη μ., 16.350, 18.22); μ. τύχα, ἀρά, A. Supp. 89 (lyr.), Th. 832 (lyr.); Ἐρινύς ib. 993 (lyr.), cf. Eu. 52; ἄτα Id. Ag. 769 (lyr.); Ἄρης ib. 1511 (lyr.); Ἅιδης S. OT 29; Ἅιδου μ. ἀνάγκα E. Hipp. 1388 (lyr.), etc.; ἡμέραι μέλαιναι, = Lat. dies atri, Plu. Luc. 27.
indistinct, Arist. Top. 106a25, Philostr. VA 4.44; βραχὺ καὶ μ. φώνημα, of Nero, D.C. 61.20.
dark, obscure, enigmatical, ἱστορίη AP 11.347 ( Phil.).
dark, malignant, μ. φρήν, καρδία, Sol. 42.4, Pi. Fr. 123.4; μ. ἄνθρωποι Plu. Lib.educ. 2.12d; μ. ἦθος M. Ant.4.28.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Comp. μελάντερος, α, ον, blacker, very black, τοῦ δʼ οὔ τι μελάντερον ἔπλετο ἔσθος Il. 24.94: prov. of thick darkness, [ νέφος] μελάντερον ἠΰτε πίσσα (v. ἠΰτε) 4.277: Sup. μελάντατος Hp. VC 14, Ar. Fr. 580, etc.:— Comp. also μελανώτερος Str. 16.4.12: Sup. μελαινότατος AP 11.68 ( Lucill.), Epigr.Gr. 320.4 ( Thyatira).

data.quote: τοῦ δʼ οὔ τι μελάντερον ἔπλετο ἔσθος

children.label: V
children.definition: μέλαινα (sc. νοῦσος), ἡ, Medic., of diseases causing black secretions (such as melaena), Hp. Morb. 2.73.

children.label: VI
children.definition: μέλαν, τό, v. sub voc. (Cf. Skt. málam ‘dirt’, malinás ‘dirty’, Lett. melns ‘black’.)
a black or livid spot, Hp. Fract. 11 (pl.), Art. 86 (pl.), Liq. 4 (sg.).

children.label: II
children.definition: black hair-dye, Apollod.Com. 21, Poll. 2.35, Crito ap. Gal. 12.447.

children.label: III
children.definition: μ. γραμμοτόκον the solid ink in a pencil, AP 6.63 ( Damoch.).

children.label: IV
children.definition: spots in the moon, Cleom. 2.1.
blackening of flesh from mortification, Hp. Aph. 5.17 (pl.).
dyeing black, μελασμοὶ τριχῶν Dsc. 1.112, Gal. 12.446.

children.label: II
children.definition: black spot, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.921f (pl.), Simp. in Ph. 1294.20; on snakes, Plu. Vind. 2.564d.

soften by boiling, γέντα βοὸς μέλδοντες Call. Fr. 309; πυθομένοις μέλδουσιν ἅμʼ ἰχθύσιν οὐλοὸν ἅλμην Man. 6.464:— Hom. only in Med. (or Pass.), ὡς δὲ λέβης ζεῖ ἔνδον . . , κνίσην μελδόμενος ἁπαλοτρεφέος σιάλοιο Il. 21.363 (vv. ll. κνίσῃ and μελδομένου):— Pass., σάρκες μελδόμεναι Nic. Th. 108. (Cf. Skt. mṛdús, Lat. mollis ‘soft’, OE. meltan ‘melt’, ONorse maltr ‘rotten’, Gr. βλαδύς.)

data.quote: πυθομένοις μέλδουσιν ἅμʼ ἰχθύσιν οὐλοὸν ἅλμην
ὡς δὲ λέβης ζεῖ ἔνδον . . , κνίσην μελδόμενος ἁπαλοτρεφέος σιάλοιο

definition: μέλε (A), Ep. 3 sg. impf. from μέλω, Od. 5.6.
μέλε (B), Att. voc., used as a familiar address to both sexes, ὦ μ.

children.definition: my friend! Ar. Eq. 671, Nu. 33, 1192, V. 1400, Pax 137, Ec. 120, 133; νὴ Δία, ὦ μ. Pl. Tht. 178e; τί κόπτεις, ὦ μ.; Men. 457: sarcastically, διαρραγείης, ὦ μ. Ar. Av. 1257. (Gramm. expl. it by ὦ ἐπι-μελ-είας ἄξιε καὶ οἷον με-μελ-ημένε, Sch. Pl. l.c. (who says it was originally used by women only), or connect it with μέλεος, Sch. Ar. Eq. 668: but it is perh. voc. of *μέλος ‘good’, cf. Lat. melior.)

definition: μελεάγριον or μελέ-αγρον, τό, a plant, Anon. ap. Suid.

children.definition: guinea-fowl, Numida ptilorhyncha, etc., named after the hero Meleager, Arist. HA 559a25, Clytusi, Scyl. 112, Agatharch. 81.
execute a recitative, Nicom. Harm. 2.

definition: μελεαί ( -αιαί cod.) · ἀστράγαλοι, ἢ νωθροί, Hsch.

children.definition: care for, be cumbered about, c. gen., πενίης Thgn. 1129: c. acc., Archil. 8, SIG 2 ( Sigeum, vi B.C.), Theoc. 10.52: c. inf., γῆμαι κακὴν οὐ μελεδαίνει ἐσθλὸς ἀνήρ a well-born man does not mind marrying a woman of mean birth, Thgn. 185.

children.label: II
children.definition: care for, attend upon, μ. τοὺς νοσέοντας Hdt. 8.115; τὰς ὑστέρας Hp. Mul. 1.17; τὴν ἄνθρωπον Aret. CA 2.10.
object of care, Μαραθὼν . . μ. ἀνδράσιν BCH 50.529 ( Attica, ii A.D.). - ή, f.l. for μελέτη, Hp. Mul. 1.67.
practice, exercise, Orac. in App.Anth. 6.140.
care, anxiety, Hom. always in pl., μελεδήματα πατρός anxieties about his father, Od. 15.8; of sleep, λύων μ. θυμοῦ Il. 23.62; μελεδήματα θεῶν the care of the gods [for men], E. Hipp. 1103 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: object of care, Χαρίτων Ibyc. 5; ἐμοὶ μ. ἰσχάς Alex. 162.15 (anap.); Μοισάων Epigr.Gr. 238 ( Smyrna).
careful, c. gen., ἔργων Emp. 112.2; μ. κερκίδα πέπλων AP 6.39 ( Arch.); δόμων φυλακὰν μ. ib. 7.425 (Antip. Sid.).
Aret. SD 1.6, Dioscorus in PLit.Lond. 98 ii 20.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hsch.; τῇσι μελεδώνεσι sufferings of a patient, Aret. SD 2.4 (- δόσεσι codd., - δόσι Hude).

definition: μελεδωνεύς, έως, ὁ, poet. for μελεδωνός, Theoc. 24.106.

children.definition: care, sorrow, in pl., Od. 19.517, Sapph. 17, Theoc. 21.5, Cerc. 7.5; ἄγρυπνοι μελεδῶναι Phanocl. 1.5: rare in Prose, Gal. 18(1).363: in h.Ap. 532, h.Merc. 447, Hes. Op. 66, Thgn. 883, the vulg. readings μελεδώνων, μελεδῶνας (as if from μελεδών) shd. prob. be corrected μελεδωνῶν, -δώνας; cf. μεληδών.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hp. Mul. 1.36.

attendant, guardian, τῶν οἰκίων μ. house- steward, Hdt. 3.61; ὁ μ. τῶν θηρίων the keeper of the crocodiles, Id. 2.65; μ. τῆς τροφῆς one who provides their food, ibid., cf. 7.31; μ. τῶν χρημάτων ib. 38; μελεδωνοὶ τῶν ἱερῶν D.H. 1.67; τοῦ τείχους Ael. NA 3.26; μ. λῃστῶν agents of pirates, Philostr. VA 3.24; title of public officials in Samos, SIG 976.63 (ii B.C.): metaph., of a learned man, πάσης πολύβυβλον ἀφʼ ἱστορίης μ. Ath.Mitt. 11.428 ( Notium).
ashen, IG 2(2).1672.307, Thphr. HP 5.7.8; cf. μελίϊνος, μέλινος.
limb from limb, ταμών Il. 24.409; διὰ μ. ταμών Od. 9.291, cf. 18.339; μ. κεδαιόμενος A.R. 2.626; μ. ξαίνειν Philostr. Her. 19.18; cf. μελιστί.
having suffered wretchedly, A. Th. 961 (lyr.).
having done wretchedly, A. Th. 960 (lyr.).

definition: μέλεος, α, ον, also ος, ον E. Or. 207 (lyr.):—

children.definition: idle, useless, οὐδέ τί σε χρὴ ἑστάμεναι μέλεον σὺν τεύχεσιν Il. 10.480; μελέη δέ μοι ἔσσεται ὁρμή Od. 5.416; οὐ μ. εἰρήσεται αἶνος Il. 23.795; μ. δέ οἱ εὖχος ἔδωκας a vaunt unearned, 21.473: neut. μέλεον as Adv., in vain, μέλεον δʼ ἠκόντισαν ἄμφω 16.336.

data.quote: οὐδέ τί σε χρὴ ἑστάμεναι μέλεον σὺν τεύχεσιν

children.label: II
children.definition: Hom., unhappy, miserable, ὦ μέλεοι, τί κάθησθε; Orac. ap. Hdt. 7.140, etc.; μέλεος γάμων unhappy in marriage, A. Th. 779 (lyr.); ὤμοι ἐγὼ σοῦ μ. S. Tr. 972 (lyr.), cf. E. IT 868 (lyr.), Men. Epit. 470.
ἔργα A. Ch. 1007 (anap.); θάνατοι, πάθα, Id. Th. 879 (anap.), S. Ant. 977 (lyr.); ὀνόματα Antiph. 209.8. [ μέλεοι is disyll. in A. Th. 878 (lyr.), 945 (lyr.).]
miserable-minded, E. IT 854 (lyr.).

definition: μελερόν μαραντικόν, καυστικόν, Hsch.; cf. μαλερός.

children.definition: singing with its wings, epith. of the cicada, AP 7.194 ( Mnasalc.).
take thought for, attend to, c. gen., Mnemos. 57.208 ( Argos, vi B. C.).

definition: μελετάω, fut. - ήσω Th. 1.80, etc., - ήσομαι Luc. Sol. 6, Philostr. VS 1.24.2:—post- Hom. Verb,

children.definition: take thought or care for, c. gen., βίου, ἔργου, Hes. Op. 316, 443: c. acc. rei, δόξαν ἀρετῆς Th. 6.11; of a physician, treat a case, Hp. Int. 27, etc.:— Pass., of the patient, ib. 26, etc.
attend to, study, οὐ δύναμαι ἀκοῦσαι, τοῦτο μελετῶν (sc. τὸ ἀκοῦσαι) Hdt. 3.115; πλήθους δόξας μεμελετηκώς Pl. Phdr. 260c.

children.label: II
children.definition: pursue, exercise, [ μαντείην] h.Merc. 557; μ. τοῦτο (sc. ἡμεροδρόμην εἶναι) Hdt. 6.105: freq. in Att., μ. σοφίαν Ar. Pl. 511; τέχνας, ῥητορικήν, Pl. Grg. 511b, 511c, 448d; practise, ἤθη, γαστριμαργίας, ὕβρεις, Id. Phd. 81e; ὄρχησιν Id. Lg. 813e; [ νόμους] E. Ba. 892 (lyr.); ἀστοῖς ἴσα χρὴ μελετᾶν S. OC 171 (anap.); τὴν τῶν πολεμικῶν ἄσκησιν Arist. Pol. 1333b39: generally, μ. ἄδικα LXX Jb. 27.4; ταῦτα μελέτα 1 Ep.Ti. 4.15; esp. practise speaking, con over a speech in oneʼs mind, λογάρια δύστηνα μελετήσας D. 19.255; ἀπολογίαν Id. 46.1; also, deliver, declaim (cf. II.5.b), λόγους D.C. 40.54:— Pass., τὸ ναυτικὸν οὐκ ἐνδέχεται ἐκ παρέργου μελετᾶσθαι naval warfare cannot be practised ‘en amateur’, Th. 1.142; εὐταξία μετὰ κινδύνων μελετωμένη discipline put in practice on the battle-field, Id. 6.72, cf. Pl. R. 455c.

inf., μετρίως ἀλγεῖν μελετᾷ σοφία practises moderation in grief, E. Fr. 46; λαλεῖν μεμελετήκασί που Ar. Ec. 119; also μ. τοξεύειν καὶ ἀκοντίζειν X. Cyr. 1.2.12, cf. Antipho 3.2.3; μ. ποιεῖν καὶ λέγειν Lys. 10.9; μ. ἀποθνῄσκειν, τεθνάναι, practise dying, death, Pl. Phd. 67e, 81a, cf. Epicur. Fr. 470.
part., μ. κυβερνῶντες X. Ath. 1.20; with ὡς and part., Id. Cyr. 5.5.47.
μ. ἔν τινι LXX Jo. 1.8, al.
study, train oneself, Ar. Ec. 164, Th. 1.80, X. HG 3.4.16; ἦν τὸ ἱππικὸν μεμελετηκός ib. 6.4.10: c. dat. modi, τόξῳ μ. καὶ ἀκοντίῳ Id. Cyr. 2.1.21; ἐν τῷ μὴ μελετῶντι by want of practice, Th. 1.142.

children.label: b
children.definition: practise oratory, declaim, Pl. Phdr. 228b; ἐπὶ τῶν καιρῶν μ. extemporize a speech, D. 61.43; Ἑλληνιστὶ μ. Plu. Cic. 4, cf. Sanit. 2.131a, Luc. Sol. 6, Philostr. VS 1.24.2, AP 11.145; of actors, Arist. Pr. 904b3.
threaten, μ. τὴν τοῦ καρκινώματος γένεσιν Leonid. ap. Aët. 16.43: abs., ἢν κρύβδην μελετήσῃ . . ἡ νοῦσος Aret. SD 2.12:— Pass., ἀπειλᾷ καὶ μελετᾶται μανία Steph. in Hp. 1.99 D., cf. Aët. 16.63.

exercise, train persons, ἐμελέτησεν [αὐτοὺς] ὡς εἶεν . . X. Cyr. 8.1.42: c. inf., οὓς ἀναβαίνειν ἐπὶ τοὺς ἵππους μελετᾷ Φείδων Mnesim. 4.7:— Pass., μελετώμενοι ὑπʼ αὐτῶν τὴν πτῆσιν, of eaglets, Philostr. VA 1.7.

data.quote: οὓς ἀναβαίνειν ἐπὶ τοὺς ἵππους μελετᾷ Φείδων

children.label: III
children.definition: to be accustomed, c. inf., μεμελέτηκε τὸ τ̄ εἰς θ̄ τρέπεσθαι An.Ox. 1.66; τὰ μὴ μελετήσαντα πάσχειν συναίρεσιν Theognost. Can. 145.25.

data.quote: μεμελέτηκε τὸ τ̄ εἰς θ̄ τρέπεσθαι

children.label: b
children.definition: acquire a habit, μελετησάντων ἐκπίπτειν βραχιόνων Gal. 14.782:— Pass., become chronic, μελετηθὲν τὸ πάθος Aët. 16.67.

care, attention, Hes. Op. 412, Epich. [284]: pl., Emp. 110.2: c. gen. objecti, μ. πλεόνων care for many things, Hes. Op. 380; μελέτην τινὸς ἐχέμεν, = μελετᾶν, ἐπιμελεῖσθαι, ib. 457; ἔργων ἐκ πολλοῦ μ. long-continued attention to action, Th. 5.69: c. gen. subjecti, care taken by one, θεῶν μελέτῃ S. Ph. 196 (anap.); of a trainer, B. 12.191: abs., μελέτῃ κατατρύχεσθαι E. Med. 1099 (anap.): pl., Emp. 131.2.
treatment, Hp. Fract. 31, 35 (pl.), Art. 50.

children.label: II
children.definition: practice, exercise, ὀξεῖα μ. Pi. O. 6.37; ἔχων μ. Id. N. 6.54; ἡ διʼ ὀλίγου μ. their short practice, Th. 2.85; πόνων μ. painful exercises, of the Spartan discipline, ib. 39; μάθησις καὶ μ. Pl. Tht. 153b; μ. θανάτου Id. Phd. 81a; ἡ ἐγκύκλιος τῶν προπαιδευμάτων μ. Ph. 1.157.

children.label: b
children.definition: exercise, drill, μετὰ κινδύνων τὰς μελέτας ποιεῖσθαι to go through oneʼs exercises in actual war, Th. 1.18; ταῖς τῶν πολεμικῶν μ. Id. 2.39; μ. ἐν ὅπλοις ποιεῖσθαι IG 2(2).1028.19, al.

children.label: c
children.definition: rehearsal, declamation, ταύτης τῆς μελέτης καὶ τῆς ἐπιμελείας D. 18.309, al.; of actors, νήστεις ὄντες τὰς μ. ποιούμενοι making their rehearsals, Arist. Pr. 901b3.

data.quote: ταύτης τῆς μελέτης καὶ τῆς ἐπιμελείας

children.label: d
children.definition: matter for discussion, μ. σοφισταῖς προσβαλεῖν Pi. I. 5(4).28; branch or object of study, Pl. Grg. 500d, al.; ὁ νόμος σου μ. μού ἐστιν LXX Ps. 118(119).77.

data.quote: ὁ νόμος σου μ. μού ἐστιν

children.definition: theme, lecture, Str. 1.2.2, Plu. Aud. 2.41d, Luc. Rh.Pr. 17; declamation, μελέτῃσί τʼ ἄριστον IG 3.625; τὰς μ. μισθοῦ ποιεῖσθαι Philostr. VS 1.21.5.
pursuit, μία οὐχ ἅπαντας θρέψει μ. Pi. O. 9.107, cf. Pl. Phd. 82a.

children.label: III
children.definition: practice, usage, ἃς οἱ πατέρες ἡμῖν παρέδοσαν μ. Th. 1.85.

data.quote: ἃς οἱ πατέρες ἡμῖν παρέδοσαν μ.

children.definition: habit, Hp. Mul. 1.17; ἢν ἐς μελέτην ἥκῃ τοῦ κακοῦ ὥνθρωπος Aret. CA 1.5; ἐν μ. γίγνεσθαι ψόφων become accustomed to noises, Stob. App. p.22 G.

data.quote: ἢν ἐς μελέτην ἥκῃ τοῦ κακοῦ ὥνθρωπος

children.label: IV
children.definition: threatening symptom or condition, of disease, μελέτη καὶ προοίμιον ἐπιληψίας Posidon. ap. Aët. 6.12; ὀδύνη . . μ. λύσεως Aët. 5.100, cf. Steph. in Hp. 1.191 D.
practice, exercise, Pl. Phd. 67d, X. Cyr. 8.1.43 (pl.), Critias 6.1; αἰσχρῶν ἔργων μ. E. Fr. 910 (anap., nisi leg. μελέδημα) ; τὰ πρὸς πόλεμον μ. practice for . . , X. Eq. 11.13.
μελετήματα φωνῆς grammatical examples, A.D. Synt. 277.26.
practising diligently, X. An. 1.9.5 ( Sup.), Longin. Rh. p.203 H. ( Sup.); συνουσίαι μ. debating societies, Philostr. VS 1.23.2.
to be treated, νοσήματα Hp. Acut. 6.

children.definition: μελετητέον one must study, Pl. Grg. 527b, Porph. Abst. 1.31: c. inf., Iamb. Protr. 5.
place for practice, Plu. Dem. 8.

mourning, cooing, περιστεραί LXX Ez. 7.16; αὐλός, = vasca, Gloss.

children.definition: ὕλη μ. a collection of meditations, D.L. 3.47.
to be gained by practice, Pl. Clit. 407b, Luc. Im. 16.
one who cares for, an avenger, ἀμφί τινα S. El. 846 (lyr.).

definition: μέλη, ἡ, a sort of cup, Anaxipp. 8.

children.definition: Posidon. 22 J., cf. Al. Ex. 29.17.

Simon. 39.1 (pl.), A.R. 3.812 (pl.), Anacreont. 14.6, AP 5.292.3 ( Paul.Sil.).

object of care, beloved object, darling, of persons, μ. τὦμον Sapph. 126, cf. Ar. Ec. 972 (lyr.), Men. Pk. 214; νέαισιν παρθένοισι μ. Pi. P. 10.59; Χαρίτων μ. Id. Fr. 95; Κύπριδος ib. 217; ὦ φίλτατον μ. δώμασιν A. Ch. 235; ὦ γραῦ, τῷ θανάτῳ μ. Ar. Ec. 905 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: charge, duty, A. Ag. 1551 (anap.); μέλον πάλαι μ. μοι S. Ph. 150 (lyr.).
care, anxiety, A. Eu. 444, Theoc. 14.2, etc.
an object of care or love to men, ῥίζα Pi. P. 4.15.
care, diligence, EM 444.54.
one must take thought, τοῦ λανθάνειν Pl. R. 365e.

definition: Μελητίδης, ου, ὁ, prov. at Athens for

children.definition: a blockhead (in form a patronymic from Μέλητος), Ar. Ra. 991 (lyr., prob.), Luc. Am. 53, etc.—In codd. usu. written Μελιτίδης: hence derived by Sch. Ar. l.c. and Eust. 1735.51 from μέλι, though second syll. is long.

definition: μέλι, τό, gen. ῐτος, etc.; dat. μέλι Philox. 3.17; gen. pl. μελίτων Emp. 128.7 (nisi leg. μελιτῶν, cf. μελιτόν):—

children.definition: honey, Od. 20.69, etc.; μ. χλωρόν Il. 11.631, Od. 10.234, Xenoph. 38.1; ξανθόν Simon. 47; παμφαές A. Pers. 612; τὸ μέλι τἀττικόν Ar. Pax 252, cf. Men. 708; various kinds, Thphr. Fr. 190; said to be made from the palm ( φοῖνιξ), Hdt. 1.193, cf. 4.194; μ. θανάτου σύμβολον Porph. Antr. 18.

μέλιτος γλυκίων ῥέεν αὐδή Il. 1.249, cf. Pi. O. 10(11).98; Σοφοκλέους τοῦ μέλιτι κεχριμένου Ar. Fr. 581; ὕπνος γλυκίων μέλιτος Mosch. 2.3; ἡ τῶν ἀνδρῶν [χολή] ἐστι πρὸς ἐκείνην μέλι Alex. 146.6: prov. μήτε μοι μ. μήτε μέλισσα, of those who refuse to take ‘the rough with the smooth’, Sapph. 113.

data.quote: ἡ τῶν ἀνδρῶν [χολή] ἐστι πρὸς ἐκείνην μέλι

children.label: II
children.definition: sweet gum collected from certain trees, manna, Arist. Mir. 831b23; τὸ ὕον μ. Polyaen. 4.3.32; μ. ἄγριον, μαινόμενον, D.S. 19.94, Str. 12.3.18. (Cf. Goth. miliþ, Lat. mel.)
manna ash, Fraxinus Ornus, Il. 13.178, 16.767, Musae. Fr. 5 D., S. Fr. 759, Thphr. HP 3.11.3, etc.; τρίτον ἄλλο γένος . . ἐκ μελιᾶν Hes. Op. 145.

children.label: II
children.definition: ashen spear, Il. 19.390, 22.225, etc.

definition: μελιαδής, ές, Dor. and Aeol. for μελιηδής.
Μελίαι, αἱ, a race of nymphs said to have sprung from the spot of earth on which fell the blood of Uranus, Hes. Th. 187, Call. Jov. 47, etc. (The name implies

children.definition: ash-nymphs.)
lyric iambics, as written by Cercidas, D.L. 6.76, prob. in St. Byz. s.v. Μεγάλη πόλις and Stob. 4.16.7.
sweet-singing, κύκνος E. Fr. 773.34 (lyr.).
sweet-toned, βοὰ αὐλοῖο AP 7.696 ( Arch.).
honey-sweet, ὕδωρ Pi. Fr. 198.
sweet-sounding, ἀοιδαί Pi. N. 11.18.
producer of honey, epith. of Ζεὺς Ἥλιος Μίθρας Σάραπις, PMag.Lond. 46.6.

definition: μελίγηρυς, Dor. μελῐ-γᾱρυς, υος, ὁ, ἡ,

children.definition: sweet-voiced, melodious, ὄψ Od. 12.187; ἀοιδή h.Ap. 519; παρθενικαί Alcm. 26.1; ὕμνοι, κῶμοι, Pi. O. 11(10).4, N. 3.4, παιᾶνος ὀμφά Id. Pae. 5.47; ἀηδών, of a woman, IG 14.1942.—Poet. word, used by Pl. Phdr. 269a.
soft-eyed, Hsch.
honey-tongued, πειθοῦς ἐπαοιδαί A. Pr. 173 (anap.); ἀοιδαί B. Fr. 3.2; ἀηδών, of a poet, Id. 3.97; ἔπη Ar. Av. 908 (lyr.); Πιερίδες Epigr.Gr. 228a2 ( Ephesus).

definition: μελιειδής, ές, f.l. for μελιηδής, Hp. Aff. 55.

children.definition: honey-jar, Peripl.M.Rubr. 6, 8:— Dim. μελι-έφθιον ( μελέφθ- Pap.), τό, PLond. 2.964.4 (iii A.D.).

definition: μελίζω (A), fut. - ιῶ LXX Le. 1.6: aor. ἐμέλισα D.H. 7.72: pf. Pass. μεμέλισμαι Opp. C. 3.159: ( μέλος A):—

children.definition: dismember, cut in pieces, Pherecyd. 32J., D.H. l.c., Apollod. 1.9.12.
Pass., have the limbs fully formed, Opp. l.c.

definition: μελίζω (B), Dor. μελίσδω, Dor. fut. Med. μελίξομαι Mosch. 3.51: otherwise only pres. and impf.: ( μέλος B):—

children.definition: modulate, sing, μελίσδειν σύριγγι Theoc. 20.28:—mostly in Med., Pi. Parth. 2 Fr. 2.66, Pl.Com. 69.13, Theoc. 1.2, 7.89, APl. 16.307.5 ( Leon.):— Pass., Phld. Po.Herc. 994 Fr. 20.
to be like music, [ λέξις] μελίζουσα μέν, οὐ μὴν μέλος D.H. Dem. 50.

of pure honey, sweet as honey, ποτόν Phaedim. ap. Ath. 11.498e, Nic. Al. 351; ῥίζα μ. πάσασθαι Id. Th. 663; τὸ μ., = μελίκρατον, Id. Al. 205.
ash-born, A.R. 4.1641.

μελιηδέα θυμὸν ἀπηύρα Il. 10.495; νόστον δίζηαι μελιηδέα Od. 11.100; ἐμὲ μελιηδὴς ὕπνος ἀνῆκε 19.551; γᾶρυς Simon. 41.
honey-fed, AP 9.122 ( Evenus?).
sweet-voiced, κύκνος AP 5.124 ( Bass.).

definition: μελίκακι σκεύασμά τι βρωτὸν μετὰ τυροῦ, Hsch.

honeycomb, Sm. Ex. 16.31.
cyst or wen, from its resembling a honeycomb, Hp. Prorrh. 2.42, Antyll. ap. Orib. 45.3 tit., cf. Sch.ad loc.

drink of honey and milk offered as a libation to the powers of the nether world, χοὴν χεῖσθαι πᾶσιν νεκύεσσι, πρῶτα μελικρήτῳ, μετέπειτα δὲ ἡδέϊ οἴνῳ Od. 10.519, cf. SIG 1025.34 ( Cos); μελίκρατα γάλακτος E. Or. 115; also, a mixture of honey and water, Hp. Aph. 5.41, Arist. Metaph. 1092b29, Com.Adesp. 128, Antyll. ap. Orib. 5.29.7, Gal. ap. Orib. 5.14.1, cf. Sch. S. OC 481, Thphr. HP 9.11.2; μ. θερμόν POxy. 1088.61.
